frameDefinitions: The Self_mover, a living being, moves under its own direction along a Path.
An Agent manipulates an Instrument in order to achieve a Purpose.
An Agent is performing the portion of an Activity in which there is dynamic stability. '' 'Not noticing the hoards of people rushing by the window, Manny continued eating his lunch.'
A Cognizer has a relatively fixed positive or negative point of view towards an Issue.
The words in this frame refer to what Clothing the Wearer (or a specific Body_part of the Wearer) has on.
Temporary or permanent Styles and Configurations of Hair, as well as its inherent Nature.
frameExamples: She <t>walked</t> along the road for a while.
For cold conditions, we recommend that you <t>use</t> a heat gun or a hair dryer to make the adhesive work better.
Not noticing the hoards of people rushing by the window, Manny <t>continued</t> eating his lunch.
In interviews , it seems like everyone is completely <t>against</t> this expenditure .
I <t>had</t> <t>on</t> the most ridiculous monkey-suit you could imagine.
On either side her head gleamed coiled <t>braids</t> of dark-gold hair , almost pale copper in the subdued light of the room .
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Self_mover</fen> is the living being which moves under its own power. Normally it is expressed as an external argument.

<fen>Source</fen> is used for any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion.
In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion.  With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
<fen>Path</fen> is used for any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen>.  This includes 'middle of path'' expressions.
<fen>Goal</fen> is used for any expression which tells where the <fen>Self_mover</fen> ends up as a result of the motion.

<fen>Area</fen> is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path.  Note that this role should not be used for cases when the same phrase could be used with the same meaning with a non-motion target, since these should be annotated with the <fen>Place</fen> FE.
The direction that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> heads in during the motion.
The time when the motion occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which a defined motion takes place.  Any specified or implied  <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen> should designate a location contained with the <fen>Place</fen>.  This role can be differentiated from <fen>Area</fen> by the fact that the annotated phrase can be used in the same meaning with non-motion targets.
The Agent uses the Instrument to achieve their Purpose.
This role identifies the purpose for which an Agent uses the Instrument.
An entity directed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that serves to bring about the <fen>Purpose</fen> of the <fen>Agent</fen>.
An <fen>Instrument</fen> that has a function associated with it.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> uses the <fen>Instrument</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the Agent uses the Instrument.

Duration denotes the length of <fen>Time</fen> from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state.
This role identifies the name of the ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> in which an <fen>Agent</fen> engages.
The <fen>Agent</fen> engages in an ongoing <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when an ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
The individual that holds an opinion on an <fen>Issue</fen> or Side.
The matter, usually concerning a course of action, which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a positive or negative opinion about.
The party or individual (generally associated with a particular position on an <fen>Issue</fen>) that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has an opinion about.
An action taken by a <fen>Side</fen> or a view that the <fen>Side</fen> takes on an issue which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> either supports or opposes.
The time period during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has the indicated point of view towards the <fen>Issue</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> takes <fen>Side</fen>s on an <fen>Issue</fen> .
The person whose clothing is under discussion.
This role identifies the <fen>Clothing</fen> that the <fen>Wearer</fen> wears.
The body part of the <fen>Wearer</fen> which is covered by the <fen>Clothing</fen>.
The time at or during which the <fen>Wearer</fen> has the <fen>Clothing</fen> on.
This role is the hair itself
This role is the Possessor of the body part.
Temporary Configurations of hair (eg braid, bun, ponytail).   Something done to the hair merely by movement.
A property of the hair (eg curly, fine, brown).  This acts much like 'Descriptor' in the Observable_bodyparts Frame.  Colors, styles, natural properties are described by this frame element.
listRoleExamples: The cat ran <fex>out of the house</fex>.
You should walk <fex>south</fex> about a block .
The hitchhikers walked <fex>in the middle of the road</fex>.
For cold conditions, we recommend using <fex>a heat gun or a hair dryer</fex> to make the adhesive work better.
Mirabella shared the mischievous vision of childlike exuberance and used the chair <fex>as a pseudo jungle gym</fex>.
I went and used that ball <fex>yesterday</fex> and i bowled 5 games and i left about 14 ten pins with it.
<fex>Last year</fex> she opposed the bill, but changed her mind after she received correspondence supporting the bill.
She was wearing a glove <fex>on one hand</fex>.
<fex>By five o'clock</fex>, he was wearing the old holey jeans and t-shirt again.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: VC Mentioned in Dispatches and 4 Distinguished Conduct Medals
the Tercentenary Jan van Riebeeck Festival
the Emblem for Reserve Force Service
the John Chard Decoration and John Chard Medal Series
the South African Union Defence Force's
